meanings.definition: A piece of furniture with hooks or pegs for hanging coats.
meanings.sent1: The coatrack by the door is full of jackets and scarves.
meanings.sent2: I always hang my coat on the coatrack when I come home.
meanings.sent3: The coatrack looked overwhelmed with all the winter gear piled on it.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a coatrack, holding onto memories and thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The coatrack stood tall, a sentinel of warmth and comfort in the hallway.

meanings.definition: To hang coats on a coatrack.
meanings.sent1: Please coatrack your jacket before entering the house.
meanings.sent2: I will coatrack my coat neatly to keep it wrinkle-free.
meanings.sent3: He tried to coatrack his backpack, but it kept slipping off.
meanings.sent4: She coatracks her clothes with precision, making the hallway look tidy.
meanings.sent5: The children coatrack their wet raincoats after playing in the rain.
